channel.title: So
channel.description: anyone going to step up and just host a god dam replica of rsc, no forums, no crying phaggots just a rsc rep.

item.title: So
item.dc:creator: @The_Boss2 The_Boss
item.description:
@The_Boss2 wrote:

Would be nice to see a somewhat replica, maybe 3-5x rate or something. People just seem to think you can’t PK or stake without maxed out stats, half the fun of RSC was training to some ‘shitty’ stats by todays standards and then going and testing it out. Oh well guess this game is dead.

Read full topic

item.title: So
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“AlCoHoLiC, post:6, topic:526396”][quote author=matty matt link=topic=645142.msg4339897#msg4339897 date=1375019562]
reps take way to long to get anywhere in the game. to many people have lives trying to train combat and skills with 1 or even 3 times would just be a pain and lead to autos. the rep is dead aint nobody got time for that.
[/quote]

thats why its good because not everyone has 99 everything in 1 week like every other server thats been created, just because a server is out you don’t have to train 24 hours of the day and have no life, its a game play it when ever the fudge you want or have time to.

why would anyone want to host any kind of rsc server when it’s going to get ddos’d to oblivion

what’s the point in this section then [/quote]The issue is that people want to compete for the first to 99 smithing, and you get teams of people sharing accounts. They end up playing 24/7 on multiple accounts, and it’s impossible for anyone that’s not in a team to get there in a reasonable time. People don’t play for fun anymore, they play to win.

As for being DDoSed into oblivion, that only happens to servers who have incompetent owners. Most people in the community think you just need to throw money at the problem, or just wait until it stops. These are both terrible ways to deal with it, because you’re wasting a ton of money for no reason or you’re just going to have a server with 0 uptime, because people will never stop.

Read full topic
